meanings.definition: The practice or profession of examining the eyes for visual defects and prescribing corrective lenses.
meanings.sent1: Optometries help people see better by checking their eyes and giving them glasses.
meanings.sent2: I visited the optometrist for my annual eye check-up and to get new glasses.
meanings.sent3: The optometrist joked that my eyes were so bad, they needed a magnifying glass!
meanings.sent4: Her expertise in optometries was like a magic wand that brought clarity to blurry vision.
meanings.sent5: The world became clearer through the lens of optometries, revealing details I never noticed before.

meanings.definition: The science of vision and the measurement of visual acuity.
meanings.sent1: Studying optometries involves learning about how our eyes work and how well we can see.
meanings.sent2: Researchers in optometries are constantly exploring new ways to improve vision care.
meanings.sent3: The professor made the complex topic of optometries seem as clear as looking through a clean window.
meanings.sent4: In the vast universe of knowledge, optometries act as the guiding star for understanding vision.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of optometries lies in unraveling the mysteries of sight, like a detective solving a case.
